intro: Kadua flynnii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and woody structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the daisy family. Kadua flynnii is known for its strong, aromatic scent and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various native wildlife species.
